event.doc_name: Defendants' Motion to Dismiss and Memorandum in Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction
Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: Plaintiffs accuse the Department of Justice (DOJ) of blindly terminating various grant agreements... This suit seeks injunctive relief requiring the reinstatement of grant agreements between Plaintiffs and DOJ’s Office of Justice Programs (i.e., specific performance).
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Dismiss and Memorandum in Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction

evidence.text: OJP sent all Plaintiffs identical emails with the following boilerplate 'explanation' as to why the grants were being immediately terminated: 'These awards are being terminated because they 'no longer effectuate[] the program goals or agency priorities.''
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

args.reason: All checklist items are complete with proper evidence; 'How_Long_Settlement_will_Last' is correctly marked as Not Applicable based on dispositive evidence from both read documents showing no settlement obligations exist (only grant terminations and litigation). No further documents need review for this item.

All checklist items complete: How_Long_Settlement_will_Last is correctly marked Not Applicable based on dispositive evidence from Defendants' Motion (Page 12) and Class Action Complaint (Page 14), showing only grant terminations and litigation exist, with no settlement obligations or duration terms present.
